qas.question: What do the people of Cyprus rely on for domestic and agricultural supply of water?
What is the total number of completed dams located on Cyprus?
What is the capacity of water that the dams on Cyprus can hold?
What has the government invested in to help supply water for Cyprus?
What percentage of domestic water do desalination plants provide on Cyprus?

context: <a0_0>Dams<a0_0/> remain the principal source of water both for domestic and agricultural use; Cyprus has a total of <a1_0>107<a1_0/> dams (plus one currently under construction) and reservoirs, with a total water storage capacity of about <a2_0>330,000,000 m3 (1.2×1010 cu ft).<a2_0/> Water desalination plants are gradually being constructed to deal with recent years of prolonged drought. The Government has invested heavily in the creation of water <a3_0>desalination plants<a3_0/> which have supplied <a4_0>almost 50 per cent<a4_0/> of domestic water since 2001. Efforts have also been made to raise public awareness of the situation and to encourage domestic water users to take more responsibility for the conservation of this increasingly scarce commodity.
